sourceMeaningMnemonic: Someone is offering you a <radical>shellfish</radical> in exchange for a <radical>kiss</radical>. This is a <kanji>bribe</kanji>! You don't want to kiss them, but that shellfish sure looks tasty.
meaningInfo: "Come on, don't you want this shellfish?" they ask, shaking it up and down at you.
readingMnemonic: You go through with the <kanji>bribe</kanji> and kiss the person, but then they snatch hold of the shellfish and run straight down the <reading>ro</reading>ad (<ja>ろ</ja>). No!!
readingInfo: This is why you never accept a bribe. One second you're staring a yummy shellfish in the face, and the next you're standing alone in the road feeling used.
